alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Heard (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 4:47PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Carroll, Heard, central Troup and western Coweta Counties through 515 PM EST ... At 447 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Centralhatchee to near Texas to Abbottsford, and moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... LaGrange, Franklin, Hogansville, Grantville, Whitesburg, Centralhatchee, Corinth, Plant Yates, Louise, Arnco-Sargent, State Line Park, Powers Crossroads, Abbottsford, Handy, Dunaway Gardens, Piedmont Heights, Plant Wansley, Harrisonville, Hillcrest, and Wares Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
